page.title: 18Leisure
page.content: We carried out a small survey to try to find out how people spent their leisure time. In the villages there are few facilities apart from the public houses and schools which can act as centres. However there seemed to be several clubs and societies which had a fluctuating membership and length of life. Most facilities were in Norwich but some were centred in Long Stratton and Wymondham. Most of the leisure pursuits were sports of different kinds, although some were more cultural including theatre, amateur drama, keeping animals, reading, cinema, hobbies such as stamp collecting, woodworking, etc.. Disturbingly, many people said either television or doing nothing.
